Tha Neen a' tachairt ri boireannaich a bhios ag iasgach, agus a' beachdachadh air margaidheachd an èisg agus deasbadan taobh a-staigh a' ghniomhachais.Neen MacKay explores the world of salmon and fly fishing in Scotland. The final episode sees Neen visiting the annual Salmon Festival in Inverness. She meets female anglers who are fast becoming a major part of the world of fly fishing, and with passionate competitors in casting. With the salmon species now under serious threat, the programme also considers some of the scientific debates currently going on within the industry.

title: Barra on the Foyle
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Barra on the Foyle, Series 1 (Shorts): Episode 11
description: Barra Best makes his journey across the great Foyle river network.
synopsis_small: Barra Best makes his journey across the great Foyle river network.
synopsis_medium: Barra Best makes a journey across the 4000 square kilometres of the Foyle river network, criss-crossing his way across the many rivers and streams that make up its great catchment.
synopsis_large: Barra Best makes a journey across the 4000 square kilometres of the Foyle network, criss-crossing his way across the many rivers and streams that make up its great catchment.Along the way he meets with some of those who work, live and play along its banks, exploring places and landscapes rarely seen on our television screens and all brought to life with some stunning aerial footage.

title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Chris Packhams Animal Einsteins, Series 1: 1. Masterminds
description: Chris Packham explores how nature’s masterminds compare to human brainpower.
synopsis_small: Chris Packham explores how nature’s masterminds compare to human brainpower.
synopsis_medium: Using brand new science and innovative techniques, Chris Packham investigates how nature’s masterminds measure up against human brainpower.
synopsis_large: In this episode, Chris Packham investigates how nature’s masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans.

title: Iolo's Pembrokeshire
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Iolos Pembrokeshire, Series 1: Episode 2
description: Iolo Williams discovers migrant birds, glow worms and barn owls in Pembrokeshire.
synopsis_small: Iolo Williams discovers migrant birds, glow worms and barn owls in Pembrokeshire.
synopsis_medium: Iolo Williams finds beautiful migrant birds in the uplands, searches for glow worms along the coast, and watches a barn owl hunt in Pembrokeshire.
synopsis_large: Iolo Williams exploring Pembrokeshire’s less well-known wildlife spots away from the well-trodden tourist paths.Iolo searches the lower slopes of the Preseli Mountains and finds newly arrived migrant birds, including one which nests underrocks. He also hunts for the mesmerizing lights produced by glow worms near Martin's Haven, and he experiences a real treat, watching an iconic nocturnal bird, the barn owl, hunt over rough grassland at dusk.

title: Shark
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Shark, Episode 3
description: An international team of scientists is trying to change perceptions of sharks.
synopsis_small: An international team of scientists is trying to change perceptions of sharks.
synopsis_medium: Wildlife series on the sharks of the world. Sharks are among the most misunderstood predators on the planet, but a team of scientists is trying to change that.
synopsis_large: Sharks are among the most misunderstood predators on the planet, but an international team of scientists is trying to change that. Their research is revealing that sharks can be sociable and intelligent, and they could even help solve some of the toughest medical challenges of the 21st century. However, their breakthroughs come just as many sharks face extinction. Science may now be the only way to save them.

title: Dealbh is Slighe
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Dealbh is Slighe, Series 1: 8. Seallaidhean Gleusta/Tuned in Views
description: Calum attempts to take an unusual photo at Sgùrr an Fhìdhleir (The Fiddler) in Assynt.
synopsis_small: Calum attempts to take an unusual photo at Sgùrr an Fhìdhleir (The Fiddler) in Assynt.
synopsis_medium: Calum a’ gabhail dealbh caran neo-àbhaisteach aig Sgùrr an Fhìdhleir ann an Asaint. Calum attempts to take an unusual photo at Sgùrr an Fhìdhleir (The Fiddler) in Assynt.
synopsis_large: Anns an t-sreath seo, tha Calum MacIlleathain a’ faighinn tlachd a’ dol gu àiteachan iongantach agus toileachas cuideachd bho a bhith a' togail dhealbhan. Tha e beò an dochas gum faigh e deagh dheilbh le ìomhaighean de dh’àiteachan, cuairtean, fiù faireachdainnean. Le seallaidhean àlainn bho air feadh Alba, bidh gach prògram a’ sealltainn Calum a’ dol air turas shònraichte a tha a’ tighinn gu crìch le cothrom dealbh àraid a chruthachadh.Tha Calum feumach air iomadach doighean-obrach airson na dealbhan a ghlacadh. Anns a’ phrògram-sa, bidh Calum a’ cleachdadh camara film airson dealbh annasach a ghabhail air na cnuic ann an Asaint. Tha e doirbh droch shealladh a lorg anns an sgìre seo agus tha dealbh na cheann do iomhaigh caran eadar-dhealaichte aig Sgùrr an Fhìdhleir. Ach am bi e ann am fonn nuair a dhìreas e suas na beanntan?Thrill-seeking Calum Maclean combines his love of exploring interesting places with that of taking photos. Featuring stunning settings from around Scotland - from the northern Highlands to the Borders, the Aberdeenshire coast to the islands of Argyll - each episode sees Calum embark on a distinctive journey that allows him opportunities to capture special images of places and his travels. His mode of travel is as varied as the locations, all the while keeping his keen photographer’s eye peeled for evocative shots employing different photographic techniques.In this episode, Calum uses an SLR film camera to capture some photos on the hills of Assynt. He crosses water and hikes up slopes to reach his destination at Sgùrr an Fhìdhleir (The Fiddler) and attempts to take an unusual photo in tune with the wonderful views.In Gaelic with English subtitles

title: Dhan Uisge
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Dhan Uisge, Series 1: 10. Easdale
description: Calum Maclean shares his passion for swimming in remote, cold rivers and lochs.
synopsis_small: Calum Maclean shares his passion for swimming in remote, cold rivers and lochs.
synopsis_medium: Series in which Calum Maclean shares his passion for swimming in remote, cold rivers and lochs. In this episode, Calum is on Easdale Island.
synopsis_large: Calum MacIlleathain a' snàmh ann an lochan agus aibhneachan reòite agus iomallach.Series in which Calum Maclean shares his passion for swimming in remote, cold rivers and lochs. In this episode, Calum is on Easdale Island.

title: Our Wild Adventures
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Our Wild Adventures, Series 1: 4. Rainforests
description: BBC presenters look back on their adventures in our precious rainforests.
synopsis_small: BBC presenters look back on their adventures in our precious rainforests.
synopsis_medium: We take a trip through the natural history archives with some of the BBC’s favourite wildlife presenters, as they remember some of their Wild Adventures in rainforests.
synopsis_large: BBC presenters look back on their adventures in our most precious of habitats – rainforests.Chris Packham recalls his visit to Pipeline Road in Panama, where he saw a staggering array of birds, and the rainforest of Peru where he witnessed the relationship between an agouti and a Brazil nut tree. Steve Backshall’s experience of rainforests has been a little more adrenaline-fuelled, as he recounts his climb of a tepui, a sheer sandstone mountain, in the rainforest of Venezuela.George McGavin remembers, with great affection, the time he was in Guyana on the hunt for the world’s biggest tarantula – the Goliath bird-eating spider. Liz Bonnin describes her time helping conservationists in the Amazon, climbing a tree to put a camera on a harpy eagle nest. While Gordon Buchanan recounts his four years living in the rainforest, learning his trade as a wildlife cameraman.

title: DNA Family Secrets
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, DNA Family Secrets, Series 1: Episode 3
description: A set of triplets want to learn their ethnicity, and gene therapy could help Leos eyes.
synopsis_small: A set of triplets want to learn their ethnicity, and gene therapy could help Leo's eyes.
synopsis_medium: Stacey Dooley helps answer life-changing questions through the power of DNA. A set of adopted triplets want to discover their ethnicity, and gene therapy could stop Leo going blind.
synopsis_large: Triplets Peter, David and Phillip were adopted as young boys and have only been able to guess where their father comes fro, guessing such places as Italy or South America. When Professor Turi King analyses their DNA and finally uncovers the truth, it changes everything they thought they knew about themselves.Tink only found out she was conceived from a sperm donor when she was 17 years old and pregnant with her first child. Since then, her relationship with the man she always believed was her father has never been the same. Tink would now like to learn about the other half of her ancestry and if she has any half donor siblings. But with 45,000 donor-conceived people in the UK, she will only be able to find a half brother or sister if they are looking for her as well. Mitchell and Manuela fear their three-year-old son Leo is slowly going blind, and they are desperate to find a cure. If specialists discover Leo's sight loss is from a genetic mutation, he could be eligible for sight-saving gene therapy. If not, there is little that doctors can do, and he is likely to be completely blind by the time he is a teenager. The only way Mitchell and Manuela can find out is through a DNA test. But Leo's results are far from simple.

title: Nighty Night
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Nighty Night, Series 2: Episode 4
description: Glen is happily married to Jill - but Jill is still happily in lust with Don.
synopsis_small: Glen is happily married to Jill - but Jill is still happily in lust with Don.
synopsis_medium: Black comedy series. Glen is happily married to Jill, but Jill is still happily in lust with Don. Meanwhile, Sue brings her new boyfriend, Vicar Arno, to visit Cath.
synopsis_large: Black comedy series. Glen is happily married to Jill, however, Jill is still happily in lust with Don. Sue 2 brings her new boyfriend, Vicar Arno, to visit Cath, who announces her pregnancy – and much to Jill’s horror, Don's impending vasectomy. Jill also meets Cath and Don's youngest son, Bruce.

title: Brian Cox's Adventures in Space and Time
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Brian Coxs Adventures in Space and Time, Series 1: 2. Aliens: Are We Alone?
description: Brian Cox looks at our attempts to discover whether we are alone in the universe.
synopsis_small: Brian Cox looks at our attempts to discover whether we are alone in the universe.
synopsis_medium: Brian Cox looks at our attempts to answer one of the most profound questions we can ask – are we alone in the universe? In this film, he explains why this search should be taken seriously.
synopsis_large: Brian Cox looks at our attempts to answer one of the most profound questions we can ask – are we alone in the universe? With scientists sending space probes to the furthest reaches of our solar system and beyond, the scientific search for alien life has begun. Inspired by a childhood love of science fiction, Brian still hopes to hear from ET. In this film, he explains why this search deserves to be taken seriously, and he explores the chances of it happening.

title: An Cuan Sgith The Minch
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, An Cuan Sgith (The Minch), Series 1: Episode 1
description: Anne Lundon takes to the seas - The Minch, both west and east.
synopsis_small: Anne Lundon takes to the seas - The Minch, both west and east.
synopsis_medium: Anne Lundon goes in search of stories and people connected to the famous stretch of sea, known as The Minch.
synopsis_large: Anne Lundon goes in search of stories and people connected to the famous stretch of sea, known as The Minch. From the west coast mainland of Scotland to the easterly coast of the Hebrides, Anne discovers how the rich culture of our coastal waters are always evolving, and kept alive by those who live beside them. Tha Anne Lundon a’ sireadh sgeulachdan agus daoine ceangailte ris a mhuir ainmeil, a’ Chuain Sgìth – bhon chost an iar tìr-mòr na h-Alba, gu costa sear Innse Gall. Tha Anne a lorg mur a tha beartas nan cladaichean againn ag atharrachadh, s’air an cumail beo leis an sluagh tha fuireach ri’n taobh. In Gaelic with English subtitles

title: Snowdonia: A Year on the Farm
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Snowdonia: A Year on the Farm, Series 1: Episode 2
description: Lambing season, the busiest time of the year, starts just as Snowdonia goes into lockdown.
synopsis_small: Lambing season, the busiest time of the year, starts just as Snowdonia goes into lockdown.
synopsis_medium: It’s lambing season, but as Covid-19 impacts the world, Snowdonia is in lockdown. The families film themselves over the busiest time of the year as 2,000 lambs arrive within six weeks.
synopsis_large: It’s lambing season in Snowdonia, but as Covid-19 spreads across the world, Wales is in lockdown. The five farming families are left to film themselves during one of the busiest times of year.For the farmers of Eryri, spring means the joy of seeing new life arrive on the farms and in the fields. Their flocks of Welsh mountain sheep will all lamb within just a few weeks and many of the cattle are also in calf. It means long hours and lots of hard work for the families.

title: Eilean Chanaigh
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Eilean Chanaigh , Series 1: Episode 1
description: An insight into island life in a fragile community with only 16 residents.
synopsis_small: An insight into island life in a fragile community with only 16 residents.
synopsis_medium: Cò ris a tha am beatha coltach agus nan dùbhlain a tha romhpa. An insight into island life in a fragile community with only 16 residents.
synopsis_large: Tha Canaigh air a’ shuidheachadh ann an cròileanach de cheithir eileannan ris an canar Na h-Eileannan Beag.  Chan eil ach sia duine deug a’ còmhnaidh air Canaigh, agus tha iad a’ crochadh gu mòr ri seirbheis a’ bhat-aiseig airson am bith-beò.Tha sinn a’ cur seachad samhradh an cuid a choimhearsnachd airson faighinn a-mach cò ris a tha am beatha coltach agus nan dùbhlain a tha romhpa, o aimsir gu solar-uisge.  Tha turasachd riatanach dha’n dòigh-beatha, agus tha iad a’ tàladh 15,000 luchd-turais gach seusan.Agus, gach bliadhna tha Geammannan nan Eilein Bhig a’ dol mu chuairt Canaigh, Rùm, Eige agus Muc, agus am bliadhna-sa tha iad a’ tilleadh a’ Chanaigh airson a chiad uair ann an ceithir bliadhna.  An dèan Muc a chuis a-rithist, neo a bheil cothrom aig Canaigh soirbheachadh ‘s iad aig an taigh?Sgeul blàth mu bheatha coimhearsnachd cugallach aig a bheil dlùth-cheangal ri chèile.Canna lies about 25 miles southwest off the coast of Skye in a cluster of four islands known as the Small Isles. But with only 16 residents living across 10 households, and with the lack of easy access to the mainland, Canna is a fragile community. We spend a summer with the residents to find out what life is like for them and how they cope with the challenges island life throws at them, from weather to water supply. We discover how tourism is a vital part of their economy and how they attract around 15,000 visitors to their island every season.And high stakes are at play when the Small Isles Island Games are held on Canna for the first time in four years, with teams from Eigg, Muck and Rum competing for the coveted trophy. Will Muck retain their winning streak or will Canna benefit from their home advantage?A heartwarming insight into a close community working together.Air a riochdachadh le Midas Media airson BBC ALBAAithris is Riochdachadh: Patricia NicLeòidStiùireadh is Camara: Scott BrownGearradh: Jonny CraigmileÀrd-Riochdaire: Mairead ChamshronProduced by Midas Media for BBC ALBANarrator & Producer: Patricia MacleodDirector & Cameraman: Scott BrownEditor: Jonny CraigmileExecutive Producer: Margaret CameronIn Gaelic with English subtitles.

title: Gorilla Family & Me
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Gorilla Family & Me, Episode 1
description: Gordon Buchanan meets the fearsome leader of his gorilla family and two baby gorillas.
synopsis_small: Gordon Buchanan meets the fearsome leader of his gorilla family and two baby gorillas.
synopsis_medium: Gordon Buchanan meets a family of rare Grauer's gorillas in the dangerous forests of the Democratic Republic of Congo.
synopsis_large: Gordon Buchanan realises a lifelong dream by gaining the trust of a family of rare Grauer's gorillas, the largest primates on Earth. In the dangerous forests of the Democratic Republic of Congo, he meets the fearsome leader of his gorilla family, Chimanuka, and two baby gorillas, one a lonely orphan. As Gordon gains the trust of these mysterious, seldom-seen gorillas, he discovers their incredible compassion and gets caught up in a battle between giant rival silverbacks for control of the family.

title: Holly Hobbie
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Holly Hobbie, Series 2: 8. The Dauntless Daughter
description: After Holly discovers a double standard, she joins Amy and Piper in an all-girl protest.
synopsis_small: After Holly discovers a double standard, she joins Amy and Piper in an all-girl protest.
synopsis_medium: After Holly and Amy experience unfair double standards, they gather Piper and the girls in their class for a protest to make their voices heard.
synopsis_large: While recording a song for a competition, Holly and Oscar keep getting distracted by Heather. After Holly kicks Heather out, Dad interrupts and Oscar gets the boot! Frustrated, Holly demands to know why she can’t have a boy in her room and discovers that it’s because she’s a girl!Meanwhile, Amy experiences her own injustice when Reggie, a classmate with a mediocre science project, gets chosen over her to attend the Regional State Science Fair. When she talks it out with her friends and Grandma Hobbie, she gets the inspiration to organize an all-girl protest. The protest is a success with Amy getting what she deserves, and as a surprise move from Dad, Holly gets to have Oscar in her room. All is well until Holly realizes that she has a crush on Oscar!

title: M.I. High
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, M.I. High, Series 7: 13. The Last Stand
description: The spies only option is to take the war to Korps.
synopsis_small: The spies' only option is to take the war to Korps.
synopsis_medium: Children's spy drama. The Korps apocalypse is nigh and in a matter of hours the PM is due to sign over power to the deputy prime minister, Evelyn Baxter.
synopsis_large: The Korps apocalypse is nigh. The world's most evil villains have now infiltrated every major organisation in the country and in a matter of hours the PM is due to sign over power to the deputy prime minister Evelyn Baxter, aka the crime minister! The spies' only option is to take the war to Korps.

title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Waffle the Wonder Dog, Series 2: 14. Waffles Sort of Birthday
description: Its Waffles birthday party, but can he stay out of trouble until his birthday surprise?
synopsis_small: It's Waffle's birthday party, but can he stay out of trouble until his birthday surprise?
synopsis_medium: Preschool comedy drama series. It's Waffle's birthday and Mr Willow throws a huge party for him. But Ruby's dog, Jelly, leads the Wonder Dog astray.
synopsis_large: It's Waffle's birthday and Mr Willow throws a huge party for him. As the Brooklyn-Bells prepare a surprise for Waffle, Connie and Ruby's dog, Jelly, leads the Wonder Dog astray.

title: Wanted: A Simple Life
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Wanted: A Simple Life, Series 1: Episode 3
description: Can island life on Skye tempt a social butterfly away from the bright lights of London?
synopsis_small: Can island life on Skye tempt a social butterfly away from the bright lights of London?
synopsis_medium: Hannah Lemon feels ready for a new and wild adventure away from the London scene, but is the Isle of Skye taking it one bridge too far for her mum to approve?
synopsis_large: Hannah Lemon has spent her twenties living in London, taking advantage of the work and social life the capital offers. But she has noticed that her friends are settling down, and she is afraid of being left behind. It’s time for a change that could inspire her work as a writer to new heights, and the romantic Isle of Skye in the Scottish Highlands beckons. Her mum Clare, meanwhile, remains unconvinced and joins her for the week in Skye to put Hannah’s island dream to the test.

title: Mystic
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Mystic, Series 2: 8. The New Future
description: In the aftermath of the earthquake, the KP gang battle to save Natasha and the stables.
synopsis_small: In the aftermath of the earthquake, the KP gang battle to save Natasha and the stables.
synopsis_medium: In the aftermath of the earthquake, Issie puts her own life in danger to try and rescue Natasha, while Tom finally accepts he has to sign the KP stables over to Ginty.
synopsis_large: No data found

title: The Baby Club
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, The Baby Club, Series 1: 10. Leaves
description: Babies and their grown-ups play with leaves and enjoy songs and story time together.
synopsis_small: Babies and their grown-ups play with leaves and enjoy songs and story time together.
synopsis_medium: Nigel and Baby Bear invite babies and their grown-ups to explore leaves through discovery, play, song and story.
synopsis_large: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Amber, Amelia, Arthur, DJ, Zadie, Betsy, Indianna and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Inside everyone’s bags in this episode are Leaves which are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding baby appropriate leaves inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The song ‘All the leaves are falling down’ features, as does a story involving Baby Bear. Plus, the Action Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

title: Rip Off Britain
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Rip Off Britain, Series 13: Episode 16
description: How you can make sure you’re protected from the growing crime of number spoofing.
synopsis_small: How you can make sure you’re protected from the growing crime of number spoofing.
synopsis_medium: How you can make sure you’re protected from the growing crime of number spoofing, in which scammers fool people into believing they are calling from a genuine bank phone number.
synopsis_large: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the latest scams hitting both the news and our pockets. They hear from the owners of lost pets taken advantage of by fraudsters as they desperately searched for their missing dogs and cats. They tell you how you can make sure you’re protected from the growing crime of number spoofing, in which scammers fool people into believing they are calling from a genuine bank phone number, and how some of the biggest names in tech are failing to help the victims of scams, even when presented with seemingly clear evidence of fraud. And there are more hints and tips from the experts in our virtual advice clinic.

title: Climate Change: Countdown to COP26
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Climate Change: Countdown to COP26, Series 1: Episode 2
description: A special series of programmes helping us make sense of the challenges facing our planet.
synopsis_small: A special series of programmes helping us make sense of the challenges facing our planet.
synopsis_medium: In the run-up to COP26, the BBC's correspondents from our bureaux around the world present a special series of programmes, helping us to make sense of the challenges facing our planet.
synopsis_large: In the run-up to COP26, the BBC's correspondents from our bureaux around the world present a special series of programmes, helping us to make sense of the challenges facing our planet. From primers on the big issues to the latest technological solutions, we explore what climate change means for your region.

title: Winterwatch
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Winterwatch, Series 10: Episode 7
description: Megan McCubbin investigates a rather surprising evolution among crabs in Northern Ireland.
synopsis_small: Megan McCubbin investigates a rather surprising evolution among crabs in Northern Ireland.
synopsis_medium: Megan McCubbin is investigating a rather surprising evolution among crabs in Northern Ireland, while Iolo Williams discovers a Hen Harrier roost in Mull.
synopsis_large: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan bring us the best wildlife from Wild Ken Hill in Norfolk. Megan McCubbin is investigating a rather surprising evolution among crabs in Northern Ireland, and she also looks into how our warming winters are seeing more short stopping in migrating birds. Iolo Williams is in his element on the Isle of Mull as he discovers a hen harrier roost and looks into the movements of some satellite-tracked individuals.

title: Julie Fowlis | Ceòl aig Baile
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Julie Fowlis | Ceòl aig Baile, Series 3: Episode 4
description: Càirdeasan ciùil à Glaschu. Music collaborations from Glasgow.
synopsis_small: Càirdeasan ciùil à Glaschu. Music collaborations from Glasgow.
synopsis_medium: Julie Fowlis a’ lìbhrigeadh prògram de chàirdeasan ciùil à Glaschu. Julie Fowlis presents a show of traditional music collaborations from Glasgow.
synopsis_large: Prògram de cheòl traidiseanta air a lìbhigeadh le Julie Fowlis. Bidh ‘Ceòl aig Baile’ a’ tadhal air sgìrean ceòlmhor agus a’ toirt seann charaidean is caraidean ùra còmhla gus ceòl a chruthachadh agus a thaisbeanadh do chruinneachadh beag de luchd-èisteachd.Bidh cuid den luchd-ciùil thraidiseanta as cliùitiche le ceanglaichean ri Glaschu rim faicinn ann am prògram a chaidh a chlàradh aig ionad ‘Film City’ ann am Baile a’ Ghobhainn.Bidh òran air a’ sgrìobhadh le Tom Waits aig Findlay Napier is Heidi Talbot agus bidh an t-seinneadair Gàidhlig, Ellen NicDhòmhnaill, a’ seinn le taic bho Brian McAlpine is Fiona NicAsgail. Cuideachd, bidh an diths, Chris Stout agus Catrìona NicAoidh, a’ tighinn còmhla le co-obrachadh air am fidheall agus a’ chlàrsaich. Trad music show presented by Julie Fowlis. Ceòl aig Baile brings old and new musical friends together to create music and perform intimate concerts at venues in hot-spot areas for traditional music around Scotland. Filmed at Film City in Govan, this features a mix of new music and standout collaborations by some of the best traditional musicians with connections to the city of Glasgow, including a Gaelic song from Ellen MacDonald who is joined by Brian McAlpine on piano and Fiona MacAskill on fiddle. Heidi Talbot and Findlay Napier cover a Tom Waits song and the renowned duo, Chris Stout and Catriona McKay, perform virtuosic fiddle and harp music.

title: Trad Ar Fad!
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Trad Ar Fad!, Series 3: Episode 1
description: Celebration of young folk and traditional music talent from Ulster and beyond.
synopsis_small: Celebration of young folk and traditional music talent from Ulster and beyond.
synopsis_medium: Celebration of young folk and traditional music talent from Ulster and beyond.
synopsis_large: Déanann Trad Ar Fad! ceiliúradh ar ghlúin úrnua do cheoltóirí traidisiúnta atá ag teacht chun cinn le blianta beaga anuas i gCúige Uladh agus níos faide i gcéin. Is í Emma Ní Fhíoruisce atá mar láithreoir ar an chlár spleodrach, lán-cheoil a ndéarnadh taifeadadh air i Muileann Mhic Con Midhe i mBéal Feirste. Beidh ceoltóirí den scoth ar an ardán lena n-áirítear Ross Ainslie agus an Sanctuary Band, Hoodman Blind agus beidh ár láitheoir ildánach féin, Emma Ní Fhíoruisce i mbun amhránaíochta fosta. Buailfidh muid le cuid de na ceoltóirí óga atá ag déanamh staidéar ar an cheol in Ollscoil na Banríona i mBéal Feirste.Trad Ar Fad! is a celebration of young folk and traditional music talent from Ulster and beyond. This exciting performance-filled programme, presented by Emma Ní Fhíoruisce, has been filmed at the Conway Mill in Belfast and features performances from top artists such as Scotland's Ross Ainslie and The Sanctuary Band, Hoodman Blind from Limerick, and our very own presenter Emma Ní Fhíoruisce. We'll also hear from some young musicians who are studying music at Queen's University in Belfast.

title: BBC Election 1970
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, BBC Election 1970, Part 2
description: A chance to relive the historic 1970 general election and its surprise result.
synopsis_small: A chance to relive the historic 1970 general election and its surprise result.
synopsis_medium: Marking its 50th anniversary, a chance to relive the historic 1970 general election and its surprise result. Cliff Michelmore presents the BBC's results coverage.
synopsis_large: Marking its 50th anniversary, a chance to relive the historic 1970 general election and its surprise result, with Ted Heath becoming prime minister on a small Conservative majority. Cliff Michelmore presents the BBC's results coverage.

title: Women at Work
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Women at Work, Series 1: 5. The Lesser Half
description: Three married couples explain their views on women and employment. (1974)
synopsis_small: Three married couples explain their views on women and employment. (1974)
synopsis_medium: In this programme three married couples explain their views on women and employment, both at home and in the workplace. (1974)
synopsis_large: In this programme three married couples explain their views on women and employment, both at home and in the workplace. synopsis_large: First transmitted in 1970. Jane Fonda, one of the most politically active actresses of her generation, self-proclaimed radical and star of Barbarella, speaks to Julian Pettifer about her family, acting career and political activism. She speaks at length about her participation in rallies and demonstrations advocating rights for Native American Indians and American soldiers as well as her views on marriage and men.

synopsis_large: Kenneth Williams explores his roots in and around London's St Pancras, where he grew up.Architecture, poetry, art and music were the formative influences on Kenneth Williams: the slum architecture of St Pancras where he grew up, the liquid poetry of his Gran's fruity anecdotes,  the art of the Marcel wave practised by his hairdresser father and the musical knees-up at The Boot pub.

title: Women of our Century
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Women of our Century, Series 1: Paule Vézelay
description: Germaine Greer interviews pioneer abstract artist Paule Vézelay. (1984)
synopsis_small: Germaine Greer interviews pioneer abstract artist Paule Vézelay. (1984)
synopsis_medium: First transmitted in 1984, Germaine Greer interviews pioneer abstract artist Paule Vézelay.
synopsis_large: First transmitted in 1984, Germaine Greer interviews pioneer abstract artist Paule Vézelay.British painter Vézelay was neglected and ignored by the British art establishment for most of her long life, but she can claim to be Britain's first abstract artist. She was born Margery Watson-Williams in Bristol in 1892, and changed her name when she  went to live and work in Paris in 1926. Her studio was a street away from Picasso's, and she was part of the group of artists who contributed to the revolution in modern art of the 1920s.

title: Saved by a Stranger
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Saved by a Stranger, Series 1: 1. Karl and Emina
description: A man caught in 7/7 and a Sarajevo survivor search for strangers who changed their lives.
synopsis_small: A man caught in 7/7 and a Sarajevo survivor search for strangers who changed their lives.
synopsis_medium: A man caught up in the 7/7 terror attacks searches for the stranger who held his hand, and a woman whose family fled war-torn Bosnia looks for the doctor who helped them escape.
synopsis_large: Karl, a trainee clinical psychologist, was a passenger on the first carriage of the Picadilly Line London Underground train - one of the four targets of the 7/7 bombings. In the moments after the bomb exploded, Karl was comforted by a woman who was standing close to him and who reached out and held his hand in the dark, smoke-filled carriage as he feared for his life. He has been looking for this mystery woman ever since, and we join his quest to try and track her down as he finally comes to terms with the event that changed his life forever.  Alongside Karl’s search we meet Emina, an NHS researcher living in Nottingham. Emina and her younger sister Edina were born in Sarajevo. As a baby, Edina was diagnosed with Down syndrome, and shortly afterwards a brutal civil war broke out across Bosnia and Herzegovina. Sarajevo came under siege, and in desperate need of medical care and with no safe way to leave the city, Edina’s doctor fought to place the family on a rare list for immediate medical evacuation. This enabled them to escape the horrors of Sarajevo and begin a new life in Birmingham. Returning to Sarajevo today, Emina is searching for the doctor who helped her family evacuate to safety and gave her sister the chance of a better life.

title: The Road to
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, The Road to Partition, Series 1: Episode 2
description: Exploring the tensions and violence that threatened the new Northern Irish state.
synopsis_small: Exploring the tensions and violence that threatened the new Northern Irish state.
synopsis_medium: The second episode explores how political tensions and outbreaks of sectarian violence threatened to destabilise the new Northern Irish state.
synopsis_large: On 22 June 1921, King George V and Queen Mary arrived in Belfast for the official opening of the first parliament of Northern Ireland. Fearful for their lives, they had come to a city scarred by bitter sectarian violence.The King’s visit to Belfast was the culmination of three centuries of history – and three years of political brinkmanship and brutal communal violence. The occasion marked the creation of the new state of Northern Ireland. A line had been drawn on the map – a new border that separated the north and south of the island.

title: Port
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Port, Series 5: Episode 4
description: Previously unseen music from the series Port, with Julie Fowlis.
synopsis_small: Previously unseen music from the series Port, with Julie Fowlis.
synopsis_medium: Julie Fowlis a’ lìbhrigeadh ceòl bhon t-sreath Port nach deach fhaicinn a-cheana. Previously unseen music from the series Port, with Julie Fowlis.
synopsis_large: Bidh Druthag Bheag Eile a’ tarraing ri chèile pìosan ciùil sònraichte a chaidh a chlàradh airson an t-sreath Port ach nach deach fhaicinn a-cheana. Anns a’ phrògram seo, ceòl a chaidh a chlàradh ann an Dùn Èideann, Corgaigh agus Luimneach ann an 2015 agus 2016. Bidh sàr luchd-ciùil ann an cuideachd Julie Fowlis agus Muireann Nic Amhlaoibh anns na trì ceàrnaidhean sin.Anns an earrann seo, bidh Mairéad Ní Mhaonaigh, le taic bho Julie, Phil Cunningham agus Anna-Wendy Stevenson, a’cur dreach àlainn air An Cailín Deas Óg. Ann an Corgaigh, bidh Julie a’coinneachadh ri Nell Ní Chróinín agus le taic bho Jim Murray, gabhaidh iad òran às an àite fhèin, Na Cleaganna. Bidh an t-sreath air a’ toirt gu ceann le Pàdruig Morrison, Niamh Dunne agus Caoimhín Ó Fearghail ’s iadsan a’cur an dreach dùrachdach fhèin air a’ phort An Là an Dèidh an Stoirm.Druthag Bheag Eile is a collection of three previously unseen musical gems from the award-winning series Port. This episode features music recorded Edinburgh, Cork and Limerick in 2015 and 2016. cast of renowned musicians joins presenters Julie Fowlis and Muireann Nic Amhlaoibh to play on three tracks.Mairéad Ní Mhaonaigh joins Julie, Phil Cunningham and Anna-Wendy Stevenson for a beautiful version of An Cailín Deas Óg. Julie meets Nell Ní Chróinín in Cork and joins her for local song Na Cleaganna, with Jim Murray accompanying. Pàdruig Morrison, Niamh Dunne and Caoimhín Ó Fearghail bring the series to a close with a moving rendition of An Là an Dèidh an Stoirm.

title: The Live Lounge Show
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, The Live Lounge Show, Series 1: 1. Foo Fighters and More: Live Lounge Special
description: In LA, Clara Amfo hosts the Foo Fighters in session and catches up with Dave Grohl.
synopsis_small: In LA, Clara Amfo hosts the Foo Fighters in session and catches up with Dave Grohl.
synopsis_medium: In LA, Clara Amfo hosts the Foo Fighters in session and catches up with Dave Grohl. Plus, live music from Chris Martin, The Script, The xx and 30 Seconds to Mars.
synopsis_large: Clara Amfo takes us behind the scenes of Radio 1's Live Lounge - the biggest live studio showcase in the world.Live Lounge sessions happen twice a week across the year, attracting an array of some of the biggest and best artists on the planet. In September however, it gets turbo-charged with a performance every weekday across the whole month.We bring you the very best of the first week of performances and Live Lounge exclusive interviews.Clara heads to LA to the legendary 606 Studio to host the Foo Fighters in session and to catch up with Dave Grohl. Also in the programme, we bring you live music from Chris Martin, The Script, The xx and 30 Seconds to Mars.This is live performance with a twist as each artist performs their own track and a cover version. Any Live Lounge listeners will know that the cover version is usually a recently released single, but not this year! To celebrate the 50th anniversary of Radio 1, the cover can be any track from the last 50 years and have we got some treats for you... Foo Fighters cover none other than AC/DC.

title: Wayfaring Stranger with Phil Cunningham
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Wayfaring Stranger with Phil Cunningham, Series 1: Episode 3
description: Phil Cunningham ends his journey at the Grand Ol Opry and the Country Music Hall of Fame.
synopsis_small: Phil Cunningham ends his journey at the Grand Ol' Opry and the Country Music Hall of Fame.
synopsis_medium: Phil Cunningham explores the musical connections between Scotland, Ulster and America. In the final programme his journey takes him to the Grand Ol' Opry.
synopsis_large: Music and history combine as renowned Scottish performer Phil Cunningham explores age-old musical connections between Scotland, Ulster and America. Featuring a wealth of music, sacred and secular, in this final programme in the series are country and bluegrass legends Rosanne Cash and Ricky Skaggs, as Phil's journey takes him to the Grand Ol' Opry and the Country Music Hall of Fame in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: Ceol le Toal
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Ceol le Toal, Series 1: Episode 1
description: John Toal introduces music from Sheerbuzz, Trú and Dani Larkin.
synopsis_small: John Toal introduces music from Sheerbuzz, Trú and Dani Larkin.
synopsis_medium: John Toal meets a range of musical guests. In this episode, he goes to Donegal, Lisburn and Belfast to meet Sheerbuzz, Trú and Dani Larkin.
synopsis_large: Sraith nua cheoil dóibh siúd a bhfuil a gcroíthe sa cheol. Tá John Toal paiseanta faoin cheol ar feadh a shaoil, agus sa chlár seo faigheann sé léargas ar a bhfuil de réimse ceoil agus tallainne i gcúige Uladh.Tugadh an leabhar Cas Amhrán dó nuair a bhí sé óg agus tá an leabhar aige ó shin. Agus an leabhar ina lámh aige, téann John ar thóir an cheoil fríd chúige Uladh.Tá tús bríomhar leis an chlár úrnua seo le ceol ó Sheerbuzz as Leitir Ceanainn. Buaileann John Toal leis an ghrúpa i gCúl Dabhcha agus faigheann sé seans cúrsaí ceoil a phlé leo. Faigheann muid blaiseadh den cheol a mheallann lucht leanúna chucu ó Namibia go hAilt a’ Chorráin.Ansin buaileann John leis an tríréad Trú. Tagann baill an ghrúpa faoi thionchair éagsúla cheoil a chuireann go mór le héagsúlacht na fuaime, agus roimh dheireadh an chláir, labhraíonn John le Dani Larkin, ceoltóir agus cumadóir, faoi na téamaí a mbíonn sí ag plé leo ina cuid amhránaíochta.A great new series for music lovers. Music has been John Toal’s lifelong passion, and in this series he taps into the great range of styles and incredible talent across Ulster. As a child, John was given the songbook Cas Amhrán. First published in 1975 and now out of print, John’s well-thumbed copy is still a reference point for him. Each week John will head off with his trusty book to meet people who are making music.The series kicks off with an exclusive performance from Sheerbuzz from Letterkenny, then to Lisburn where John meets the melodious trio known as Trú. Their mixture of musical backgrounds and voices makes for a very special musical experience. Singer-songwriter Dani Larkin chats to John about the themes that currently occupy her compositions before she finishes the show in style.

title: Alleluia!
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Alleluia!, Series 5: Episode 11
description: Sailm, laoidhean is sgeulachdan pearsanta. Psalms, hymns and personal stories
synopsis_small: Sailm, laoidhean is sgeulachdan pearsanta. Psalms, hymns and personal stories
synopsis_medium: Glasgow Islay Gaelic choir sing Gabh Mo Bheatha ’s Bitheadh I and Ruairidh Alastair MacLennan talks about the role faith plays in his life.
synopsis_large: Bidh Iain MacFhionghain a’ toirt thugaibh laoidhean, sailm agus sgeulachd pearsanta.  Cluinnear Còisir Ghàidhlig Ìleach Ghlaschu a’ seinn Gabh Mo Bheatha ’s Bitheadh I agus bidh Ruairidh Alastair MacIllFhinnein ag innse mun a' bhuaidh a th' air a bhith aig creideamh air a bheatha. Bidh Cairistìona Stone a’ toirt dhuinn smuaintean spioradail agus seinnidh Innes MacSuain, Niall MacIllFhinnein & Iain Moireasdan Salm 100. Cluinnear cuideachd  Mairead NicIllinnein a’ leughadh  bhon leabhar Gliocas Bho’n Bhìoball  Le Dòmhnall Saunders agus bidh Iain a’ leughadh bho Leabhraichean an Tiomnaidh Nuaidh.  Iain Mackinnon presents hymns, psalms and a personal faith story. Glasgow Islay Gaelic choir sing Gabh Mo Bheatha ’s Bitheadh I and Ruairidh Alastair MacLennan talks about the role faith plays in his life. Christine Stone offers some spiritual thoughts while Innes MacSween, Niall MacLennan and Iain Morrison sing Psalm 100. Mairead MacLennan narrates some verses from the book Gliocas bho’n Bhìoball by Donald Saunders and Iain reads from the Gospels of the New Testament. In Gaelic with English subtitles

synopsis_large: Tha Opry le Daniel a’ tighinn gu BBC ALBA, luma-làn tàlant aig cridhe ceòl dùthchasach. Le Daniel O’Donnell a’ lìbhrigeadh agus Anna Nic na Ceàrdaich ag aithris. Anns a phrògram sònraichte mu dheireadh dhen t-sreath, tha Margo, piuthar Daniel air an àrd-ùrlar. Dheibh sinn sgeulachd neo dha mu beatha agus iomadach oran cliutach bho Marog a tha comhrrachadh corr is leth-cheud blidhna air an ard urlar. Air a chlàradh ann an Foràm nam Mìle Bliadhna ann an Doire agus ann an cuideachd luchd-èisdeachd, tha Opry Le Daniel a' toirt a-steach an luchd-ciùil dùthchasach as cliùitiche bho air feadh Èirinn agus na S.A.Daniel O’Donnell is master of ceremonies and Anne Sinclair narrates the series. In the final, specially extended programme of the series Margo, Daniel’s sister, takes centre stage. We’ll get stories and a selection of her most popular songs celebrating her 55 years in showbusiness. Recorded in front of a live audience, Opry le Daniel introduces the cream of country music artists from the length and breadth of Ireland and the US, from the Millennium Forum, Derry.In Gaelic with English subtitles

title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing, Series 3: Episode 2
description: Paul takes Bob to Hertfordshire’s River Lea, where Paul fished as a teenager.
synopsis_small: Paul takes Bob to Hertfordshire’s River Lea, where Paul fished as a teenager.
synopsis_medium: Paul and Bob visit Paul’s teenage fishing haunt, the River Lea in Hertfordshire.
synopsis_large: Paul takes Bob on a trip down memory lane and back to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to come as a teenager with his mates. They would catch the train from north London to fish this network of rivers and canals that flow from Hertfordshire into the Thames, and just like when Paul was young, Paul and Bob fish for perch.They start their trip in a quiet and secluded stretch of the Lea. Paul gives Bob a copy of The Compleat Angler by Izaak Walton, a 17th-century fishing guide that was written here in Hertfordshire on the Lea and takes the form of a conversation between a skilled angler and his apprentice. Drawing the obvious comparisons, Bob delves into the book over the course of the trip to see if any of its contents still ring true today. They agree they need to be stealthy on this stretch of river, and in hushed tones they chose a suitable spot and settle in. The whispered conversation turns to their teenage years, and they discuss their memories of school dinners, bands they were in and making friends. Bob has prepared Paul a riverside picnic inspired by his trips here when he was young – jam and banana sandwiches and crisps - bringing them both a Proustian rush of teenage, packed-lunch nostalgia. For this episode, Paul has invited a special guest along to the river – Feargal Sharkey, former lead singer of The Undertones turned angler and river conservationist, who fishes the River Lea regularly. As well as discussing their love of fishing, Paul reveals an amusing connection he has to Feargal, which could have seen his life turn out quite differently.   Bob reveals their home for this trip will be a narrowboat, nestled in a quiet section of the canal, close to where they will fish the next day. Over a drink at the end of the day, Paul shares some teenage photos of him and his friends - Bob finds the 1970s hairstyles particularly unusual.On their second day on the River Lea, they return to one of Paul’s favourite haunts – a weir pool that hasn’t much changed since he used to visit, and still home to roach and dace. As they fish, they compare being a teen in the 70s to now, and how ambitions change over time. Bob reads from The Compleat Angler, choosing a section to reveal his gratitude to Paul.They return to the houseboat that evening, and Bob is cooking another 1970s-inspired dish – corned beef and potato pie, just like Paul’s mum used to make. To their surprise, they find it rather tasty after a day out fishing. To round off the trip, Bob performs a song he has written all about what they got up to during their two days on the Lea.

synopsis_large: Best Home Cook series returns with a new lease of life - brand new kitchens, tougher challenges and an exciting and tense finale each week. There is also a new addition to the judging line-up with Michelin-starred chef Angela Hartnett joining the queen of home cooking, Mary Berry, and fruit and veg expert Chris Bavin. Hosted with wit and warmth by Claudia Winkleman, ten talented home cooks embark on the ultimate immersive cooking competition, living together in a shared house and competing against each other whilst the trio of judges look on and put their cooking prowess to the test.Each week, the cooks face two challenges - Mary’s 'ultimate' task, preparing dishes for special occasions, and Chris’s incredibly difficult 'rustle up' challenge, where they have one star ingredient and one hour to create a mid-week masterpiece. Those who haven’t impressed enough across these two challenges will be picked to take part in Angela’s dreaded eliminator where the cooks go head to head and must follow one of Angela’s recipes, perfectly. This week Mary challenges the cooks to produce their ultimate Italian pasta dinner, while Chris requires them to rustle up a dish based around a piece of fruit.

synopsis_large: Cardiff-based hopeless romantic Lewis just can’t help hearing wedding bells and talking through future life plans on date one, but that’s not the only obstacle to him getting a second date. If he’s not ranting about his exes, he’s zoning out mid-conversation, leaving his dates lost for words and never calling them again. Tired of listening to yet another of his first-date failures, Lewis’s best mate Megan thinks it’s time for an intervention, so she enlists the help one of Gen Z’s sassiest sex and relationships experts, Oloni, to drop some hard home truths on 20-year-old Lewis to try to end the bad habits that send his dates running for the hills. Oloni gives Lewis a reality check as his friends and exes tell it how it is via video feedback, explaining where it’s all going wrong. Oloni and Megan watch on as Lewis goes on a series of first dates that will challenge him to rethink his dating behaviour and become a better dater. Can Lewis ditch the wedding planning, stop raking up stories about his exes and focus on the conversation long enough to prove he can be a good date?

Team Linzi are hoping to create a ‘musical woodland’, while team Vicente are attempting an abstract art sculpture inspired by the local wildlife. But as the clock ticks down, will the teams manage to finish their ambitious projects, and which one will win the competition and the coveted Golden Axe?

title: The Tournament
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, The Tournament, Series 1: Episode 20
description: Eight players do battle in the ultimate knockout quiz. Hosted by Alex Scott.
synopsis_small: Eight players do battle in the ultimate knockout quiz. Hosted by Alex Scott.
synopsis_medium: In the ultimate knockout quiz, eight players do battle on the Tournament Run in a series of exciting tug-of-war quiz matches. Hosted by Alex Scott.
synopsis_large: In the ultimate knockout quiz, eight players do battle on the Tournament Run in a series of exciting tug-of-war quiz matches as they attempt to knock their opponents out of the game and steal their cash. Only one player will be left standing at the end, but can they make it all the way to the Golden Run to double their money? Hosted by Alex Scott.

synopsis_medium: Ed Gamble, Sian Gibson, Dara O’Briain and Sindhu Vee test their general knowledge skills on a new series of games set by host Richard Osman.
synopsis_large: Ed Gamble, Sian Gibson, Dara O’Briain and Sindhu Vee take on a series of quiz rounds selected by quiz legend Richard Osman. Richard has some surprises up his sleeve, including a House of Games house band led by David O’Doherty, and he’s invited an audience around to join in. Will the winning stars opt for the coveted House of Games suitcase set, or instead go for the brand new House of Games pizza oven?

title: The Apprentice
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, The Apprentice, Series 16: 5. Gaming

synopsis_small: The teams create their own computer game and pitch their concept to games investors.
synopsis_medium: The teams' next task is to create their own computer game and pitch their concept to a panel of hugely successful games investors.
synopsis_large: This week, Lord Sugar summons the candidates to the immersive entertainment complex Samsung KX in London. He reveals to them that for this week’s task they will be creating their own computer game. They will need to create a game demo along with a character, before pitching their concept to a panel of hugely successful games investors.The task requires the teams to tackle this growing market and tap into trends. Half of the team oversee the branding of their new game, where a lack of attention to detail on one team leads to them getting a very frosty reception at their pitch. The other half of the team oversee the design of their game.Both teams set their sights on the investors in the hope that their game will win them over. But mistakes and poor decisions mean investments are a struggle.In the boardroom, Lord Sugar powers up, and for one candidate on the losing team it’s game over, as they are told, You’re fired!

synopsis_small: On the queens' first night off, Vinegar finds action at the club and Divina has the flu.
synopsis_medium: On their first night off from tour, the queens hit a local drag show. Vinegar finds some action, but Divina cuts out early as her worsening flu continues to plague her.
synopsis_large: The queens hit a local drag show on their first night off from the tour. Bear magnet Vinegar finds some action at the club while others cut out early, including Divina, whose worsening flu continues to plague her.

synopsis_medium: EastEnders legend Natalie Cassidy gives an acting masterclass, whilst Michelle Visage and Graham Norton star on the judging panel.
synopsis_large: The search for the UK’s next Drag Race superstar continues in the penultimate episode of the series. This week the queens’ acting skills are put to the test as they star in a new soap opera BeastEnders. To help them with their roles, EastEnders legend Natalie Cassidy, aka Sonia, gives the girls a soap acting masterclass, whilst Michelle Visage and Graham Norton and an extra special guest judge join RuPaul to deliberate the fate of the remaining queens.

title: Antiques Road Trip
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Antiques Road Trip, Series 23: Episode 21
description: On their first trip together, Margie Cooper and Paul Martin search for winning antiques.
synopsis_small: On their first trip together, Margie Cooper and Paul Martin search for winning antiques.
synopsis_medium: Dealers Margie Cooper and Paul Martin pick up Edwardian furniture and tribal art on a road trip through Somerset. Margie goes on a safari while Paul hopes for big profits.
synopsis_large: Dealers Margie Cooper and Paul Martin travel through Somerset and Wiltshire on their first road trip together. Margie is a veteran road tripper, but this is only Paul’s second outing, so there’s much at stake as they compete to find profitable items to sell at auction. What will entice them to spend their £200 budget? In a strawberry red Jaguar, they are both on top form, uncovering an eclectic mix of items, from Edwardian furniture to East African tribal art. Along the way, Margie learns about the first safari park outside Africa, and Paul discovers one town’s historic link with safety on our railways. But who will come out on top at the end of the day when their lots go under the hammer?

title: The Great British Sewing Bee
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, The Great British Sewing Bee, Series 3: Episode 6
description: The three finalists enter the sewing room for the very last time.
synopsis_small: The three finalists enter the sewing room for the very last time.
synopsis_medium: The competition reaches its conclusion as the three finalists enter the sewing room for the very last time, with the judges looking for cutting-edge designs.
synopsis_large: The competition reaches its conclusion as the three finalists enter the sewing room for the very last time. Judges May Martin and Patrick Grant must decide who has done enough to be crowned Britain's best amateur sewer, and they have saved their most complicated and demanding challenges for last.  Across the three garments, they will be looking for avant-garde cutting-edge designs and the trickiest pattern cutting ever seen on the Sewing Bee. The formidable first challenge sees the sewers taking on a pattern as complex as origami - with no diagrams to help them. The brain-teasing instructions almost prove too much for one of the finalists. The next challenge sees alterations so extraordinary they leave Patrick speechless, and finally they are asked to fit an avant-garde dress for a model they weren't expecting, before Claudia Winkleman announces the winner of this year's Great British Sewing Bee.

title: Hot Property
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Hot Property, Series 2: 4. Cardiff
description: Filly is in Wales with Lloyd, who hasn’t had much luck with the ladies.
synopsis_small: Filly is in Wales with Lloyd, who hasn’t had much luck with the ladies.
synopsis_medium: Filly is in Wales trying to turn things around for Lloyd, who hasn’t had much luck with the ladies.
synopsis_large: Filly is in Wales trying to turn things around for Lloyd, who hasn’t had much luck with the ladies. Lloyd wants to meet someone creative, and there are three very different possibilities from which he can take his pick: a beauty queen that loves all things pink, a musician and a practising witch.

title: Only Connect
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Only Connect, Series 17: 16. Ramblers v Data Wizards
description: Two teams who won their opening heats return for the next stage of the competition.
synopsis_small: Two teams who won their opening heats return for the next stage of the competition.
synopsis_medium: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the series where knowledge will only take you so far. Two teams who won their opening heats return for the next stage of the competition.
synopsis_large: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the series where knowledge will only take you so far. Patience and lateral thinking are also vital.Two teams who won their opening heats return for the next stage of the competition. They’ll try to draw together the connections between things which at first glance, seem utterly random.So join Victoria if you want to know what connects Belarus, Penguin, Edelweiss and Sauvignon Blanc.

title: There's No Place Like Tyrone
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Theres No Place Like Tyrone, Series 3: Episode 2
description: John helps granddaughter Maisie raise funds for a brand new toy tractor.
synopsis_small: John helps granddaughter Maisie raise funds for a brand new toy tractor.
synopsis_medium: Constructed reality series set in Northern Ireland’s largest county. Grandad John helps Maisie raise cash for a toy tractor, Rebecca plans a trip, and Darryl records a new song.
synopsis_large: Doting grandad John has some business suggestions to help granddaughter Maisie raise the funds for a brand new toy tractor. Ruth plans a much-needed change of scenery for veterinary nurse and part time farmer Rebecca, and Darryl’s quest to make a living from music continues when he books a studio to record a brand new single co-written with his dad Feargal.

title: Ibiza Dreams
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Ibiza Dreams, Series 1: Episode 4
description: As summer ends, the group have one last chance to turn their dreams into reality.
synopsis_small: As summer ends, the group have one last chance to turn their dreams into reality.
synopsis_medium: As the summer comes to an end, Cat and Liam solidify their relationship, Jake’s dad finds out about his secret side hustle, and the boys get a job at a club owned by Wayne Lineker.
synopsis_large: As the season comes to an end, the group have one last chance to turn their dreams into reality. Brothers Liam and Callum and their best mate George have been trying all summer to build their new videography business. Having arrived on the island with zero experience, they’re trying to exchange their services for social media exposure. They finally land a new job when Wayne Lineker, owner of super club O Beach, asks them to make a number of videos promoting an event.Jake’s dad flies in to visit him at the end of the season and is surprised to learn about Jake’s secret side hustle. Jake began selling semi-naked photos of himself online to supplement his work as a 'butler in the buff'. But despite his initial shock, Dad is proud that Jake has been able to support himself during his first summer away from home. Liam and Cat started seeing each other soon after they met at the start of the season. They have a heart to heart when they finally go on their first date, but when Liam is offered an exciting work opportunity in Thailand and Cat lands her dream job as a swimming instructor, will they stay together when the summer ends?

title: Teen Taxi
tags: BBC, iPlayer, TV, Teen Taxi, Series 2: 1. Halloween

synopsis_small: It’s fright night for Caitlin, Hannah and Josh!
synopsis_medium: It’s fright night and Caitlin is stalked by a clown, Hannah and her family compete as to who is the most scarily dressed while Josh lands a job terrifying children
synopsis_large: No data found
